body: Hi @thomaslee , would you have time to rebase this patch?

Yeah, agree that we'll need more complete metadata for connectors. Especially for the much anticipated connector discovery service ;)

Oops, I missed @junrao comments! sorry.
1. Moving Javadoc is a bit more challenging, I'll do it in a separate jira (hopefully I'll have time for it next week)
2. configDef.toHTML no longer has "required", lack of default is what makes something required and we sort accordingly. See KAFKA-2702 for the discussion and patch.
@guozhangwang: I believe I did mention the new Producer as "Producer" and called the old producer "Old" (see documentation.html)
Thanks for the patch. LGTM
Thanks for the patch. LGTM
@gwenshap This patch appears larger than it is -- one file got renamed and only had minimal changes, but it's showing in the diff as huge additions + removals.
LGTM except a few minor comments. Could you file a PR against the 0.9 branch as well?

@gwenshap In the API section, we only list the new producer API as a subsection and left an extra link for the old producer APIs; while in the Configs section, we keep both configs of the new and old producers as separate subsections. So I was wondering if we could be consistent and only list an extra link for old producer configs and remove the subsection.

@hachikuji @guozhangwang just curious why don't we want to indicate rebalancing via some error code? Are we recommending that always check state of group before actually sending describeGroup request? Do we recommend checking the state before listGroup as well?

@SinghAsDev DescribeGroup returns the state of the group as a string. There are two choices: either check that the group is "Stable" before parsing the member assignments, or modify the parser to accept empty input. Either way, it is probably useful to report the state of the group in the output of the command.
@hachikuji I agree those are viable solutions. However, I am trying to understand why `GROUP_LOAD_IN_PROGRESS` error code does not apply in this case.

Looks really really good. 

Two minor comments.

The load in progress error doesn't really have anything to do with
rebalancing. This is used when the group has failed over to a new
coordinator, which initially must load the group's metadata. We could
return the error code for rebalance in progress, but there seems little
reason to do so since we include the state directly. Also, it's not really
an error for describe group for the group to be in a rebalancing state.
On Nov 8, 2015 10:06 AM, "Ashish Singh" notifications@github.com wrote:

> @hachikuji https://github.com/hachikuji I agree those are viable
> solutions. However, I am trying to understand why
> {{GROUP_LOAD_IN_PROGRESS}} error code does not apply in the case.
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/apache/kafka/pull/447#issuecomment-154854488.
@hachikuji thanks for all the info. One more question, if a group's state is not "stable", rebalancing could be the only reason for it?
LGTM, one minor comment about "comments" :)
LGTM, thanks.
Thanks, LGTM.
@gwenshap Thanks, updated with fixes/comments.
@SinghAsDev The group might also be dead. Those are basically the three states, though we split the rebalancing state into two phases: PreparingRebalance and AwaitingSync.

I would like to add a unit test for graceful close, since I think some more code changes may be required for graceful termination. I wanted to submit this PR first since this is a small change which prevents leaking of file descriptors (slightly more critical than graceful termination)

LGTM. One minor note: I think the rethrow in commitOffsets() might not be needed since the isShuttingDown flag is used to break out of the loop. However, I actually prefer to keep it that way since it maintains the invariant that wakeups are guaranteed to reach the poll loop.
@granders @gwenshap I have rebased again. If this looks OK to you, could you commit this.

Admittedly this is not the most elegant way of patching this issue, as I feel the new / old consumer's usage pattern is quite different and tricky to be unified, and a better solution would be a new MM class that only uses new clients, but that may be worth another ticket.

@SinghAsDev We could have other protocol types moving forward besides "kafka consumer", like "kafka connector" and "kafka stream", so this log entry is not completely wrong. Maybe we can reword it as

`"Group {group-id} is not a valid kafka consumer group but belongs to {@protocol_type if not empty, otherwise "not exist"}."`
@guozhangwang Have you verified that the corresponding system test passes with this change?
LGTM as is, @granders do you want to take another look?
@guozhangwang I have a couple commits to add shortly to fix checkstyle issues and a couple test improvements.
Not yet, could you let me know which test case I should verify against? And how often it was reproducible before (I think it is timing dependent)?
@guozhangwang done.
LGTM

@guozhangwang You'll need to update the `@ignore` annotation for this particular test so it only ignores the `clean_shutdown: false, new_consumer: true` case

you can run with:
`ducktape tests/kafkatest/tests/mirror_maker_test.py::TestMirrorMakerService.test_bounce --parameters '{"clean_shutdown":true, "new_consumer":true}'`

This test failed for me on every run, but the process hang tended not to manifest until after a few bounces.
Nit: If it falls in the else condition it will print "that belongs to not exist" that seems non sensical, IMHO. What about "belongs to none"? Or something alike. Up to you. :)
LGTM.
Haha, okay then ¯_(ツ)_/¯'

Aren't we missing documentation (or auto-generation) of the configuration properties?

@guozhangwang Certainly, I will ping you after 0.9.0 release. Thanks.

@junrao After reading the controller code, and based on Guozhang's description in KAFKA-2721, I think the problem is that, on controller failover, the new controller will send LeaderAndIsrRequest with higher partitionLeaderEpoch for partitions that are still under reassignment. This duplicated LeaderAndIsrRequest will not be caught by the code you mentioned. Does that make sense?
LGTM. Thank you for the docs!
I think the placement is good.
Merged to 0.9.0

Codegen looks good too.

You are right on mis-ordering, "internal.key.converter" appears way too high on the list :)
We can fix this later.
@lindong28 : Are you saying that we always increase leaderEpoch during controller failover for reassigned partitions? Could you describe what part code does that?

LGTM
LGTM.
Also picked to 0.9.0 branch.

One last minor thing, otherwise LGTM:

In `services/kafka/__init__.py`, maybe add:
`from kafkatest.services.kafka.util import TopicPartition`

This makes it so external code doesn't need to know where TopicPartition lives, and possible for external code to use TopicPartition with
`from kafkatest.services.kafka import TopicPartition` 

I think it's easier to refactor the stuff underneath `services/kafka/` without disturbing external code this way
@gwenshap We can probably live without this fix, but it's tiny and avoids generating errors in the logs. Would be nice to get it in before the RC.
LGTM.

I think I've got this stabilized via a number of other bug fixes that are now committed. Two issues remain: #476 and #480. When those are merged, I can update this branch and we can verify one final time that this is now stable.
@junrao Do you mind taking a look?
LGTM
Thanks for the PR @Mszak. I left a few comments. Also, there are now some merge conflicts with trunk. Can you please fix those?

@junrao Yes that is my understanding. Though I maybe wrong.. Here is the order of functions called inside class `KafkaController` that lead to `LeaderAndIsrRequest` with incremented `leaderEpoch`:

```
onControllerFailover()
maybeTriggerPartitionReassignment()
initiateReassignReplicasForTopicPartition()
onPartitionReassignment()
updateLeaderEpochAndSendRequest()
updateLeaderEpoch()
```

`updateLeaderEpoch()` will read `LeaderIsrAndControllerEpoch` from zookeeper, increment `leaderEpoch` by 1, and write this back to zookeeper. A `LeaderAndIsrRequest` will later be constructed with incremented `leaderEpoch` and sent to brokers in `ControllerBrokerRequestBatch.sendRequestsToBrokers()`

@fpj Sorry, I pushed an update when I found the same problem. Did you try the newest version? 

I ended up testing by using git archive to generate a separate tar file without the .git directory and in both the git and tar versions ran `gradlew test`. The .git one properly ran rat (which you can see in the log) and the tar one just skipped it and ran all the tests successfully.
